abstract: Longtime shareholders, some of them families that owned Bank of America’s legacy banks, are alarmed by the daunting challenges confronting the company.
snippet: Longtime shareholders, some of them families that owned Bank of America’s legacy banks, are alarmed by the daunting challenges confronting the company.
lead_paragraph: For more than 70 years, through good times and bad, the Eliasberg family stood by their bank. Their tiny lender grew up to become part of what is now Bank of America  tying the family’s fortunes to that of the nation’s largest bank.

headline.main: Investors Air Discontent With Bank of America
headline.print_headline: Investors Air Discontent With Bank Of America

abstract: Bank of America’s chief executive, Kenneth D. Lewis, seemed to be singing for his job on Monday during a conference call with Wall Street analysts to discuss the bank’s first-quarter results.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America’s chief executive, Kenneth D. Lewis, seemed to be singing for his job on Monday during a conference call with Wall Street analysts to discuss the bank’s first-quarter results.

headline.main: Lewis Sings Praises of Merrill and Countrywide Deals
